title: Inscriptions craze proves stark contrast between Ethereum rollups - Blockworks
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in under 256 tokens:

Inscriptions on Ethereum-based networks have been on the rise, causing network congestion and operational disruptions.

Zero-knowledge rollups like zkSync, StarkNet, and Polygon's zkEVM have been able to handle the increased transaction volumes with lower gas fees due to their ability to amortize the cost of validity proofs.

The mechanics of zero-knowledge proofs and the architecture of these rollups allow for batching transactions before submitting them to the Ethereum mainnet, significantly lowering gas fees.

The recent upgrade to zkSync's Boojum prover has improved its transaction capacity, and the network currently has the lowest transactions costs among all layer-2s.

Other Ethereum scaling solutions, such as Polygon's POS chain, have also handled the extra traffic well, with gas fees maxing out at a lower cost.

Zero-knowledge technology is seen as the future of Ethereum scaling, and many networks are exploring this solution.

title: 152 Stories To Learn About Ethereum Blockchain - hackernoon.com
summary:
Sure! Here's a summary of the financial news in less than 256 tokens:

title: Ethereum (ETH) Price at $5,000 Predicted by BitMex Founder Arthur Hayes - U.Today
summary: Arthur Hayes, founder of BitMex, predicts that the price of Ethereum (ETH) will reach $5,000 based on a message he received during meditation. Hayes sold his Solana holdings and doubled down on Ethereum, citing market dynamics and a higher power's guidance. This follows his earlier call predicting Solana's price to reach $100, which has proven accurate. Despite Ethereum's underperformance in recent weeks, Hayes believes the cryptocurrency has more room for growth.

title: Exclusive: NY financial regulator approves Paxos expansion to Solana, allowing for its first stablecoin issuance beyond Ethereum - Fortune
summary: Paxos, a leading stablecoin issuer, has received regulatory approval from the New York Department of Financial Services (DFS) to expand its products to the Solana blockchain. This marks a significant step for the company, which has been the most regulated stablecoin issuer in the world. Paxos plans to launch its stablecoin, USDP, on Solana on January 17, 2024. The company's expansion to Solana is a strategic move to take advantage of the blockchain's faster transaction speeds and lower costs compared to Ethereum. Paxos's partners, including major financial players like PayPal, Mastercard, and MercadoLibre, will also benefit from the Solana expansion. While Paxos has faced missteps in the past, such as the Binance partnership, the company remains committed to working directly with regulators to ensure customer protections are in place. With this expansion, Paxos aims to enable a new wave of adoption for stablecoins and potentially issue stablecoins across other layer-1 and layer-2 blockchains in the future.

title: Bitcoin's Rally Outshines Ethereum and Other Cryptos • - Contxto
summary: Bitcoin's price has surged by 162% this year, outperforming Ethereum and other cryptocurrencies. While Bitcoin enjoys favorable speculative optimism, Ethereum's network struggles to maintain its historically strong position. Ether's underperformance is notable against Bitcoin's gains and the rises of newer players like Solana and Cardano. Despite its pivotal role in the crypto ecosystem, Ethereum's influence wanes as new technologies emerge. The broader crypto market is shifting towards AI-driven tokens, which have become a standout theme and outperform traditional offerings. As the year concludes, the crypto market reflects a complex interplay of technological innovation, regulatory scrutiny, and shifting investor sentiments, setting the stage for an unpredictable 2024.

title: Ethereum (ETH) Price Set to Dominate – $5,000 in 2024? - Coinpedia Fintech News
summary: Ethereum (ETH) price is expected to reach $5,000 in 2024, driven by factors such as its transition to a proof-of-stake model and potential ETF approval. Analysts and experts, including Arthur Hayes, are optimistic about Ethereum's prospects, with some shifting their focus from other cryptocurrencies like Solana (SOL) to Ethereum. Technical indicators such as RSI and MACD support a positive outlook for Ethereum's growth. Hayes has dumped his SOL holdings and bought more ETH, predicting a value of $5,000.

title: Solana Flips Ethereum in DEX Volume and NFT Sales - The Defiant - DeFi News
summary: Solana overtakes Ethereum in DEX volume and NFT sales, with $10B in DEX volume and $109M in NFT sales in the past week. Solana's token, SOL, has seen a 670% increase in market capitalization and is now in the top 5 largest cryptocurrencies. Memecoins are fueling the current frenzy, with BONK and Dogwifhat seeing significant gains. At least three web3 startups have moved to Solana, and Paxos has received authorization to issue its USDP stablecoin on the network. Large entities such as Visa and Shopify have also added support for Solana this year. The question on traders' minds is whether Solana can maintain its momentum.

title: Ethereum Gears Up for Data Storage Breakthrough with Dencun - Watcher Guru
summary: Ethereum is gearing up for a major network upgrade called Dencun, which will introduce data storage capabilities and scale the blockchain through a process called "proto-danksharding." The upgrade is set for 2024 and will reduce fees for layer 2 rollups and expand data capacity on the blockchain. Ethereum developers are currently testing Dencun on test networks, with a target date of January 17th for a test run on Goerli. If testing progresses smoothly, the upgrade is expected to roll out on the Ethereum mainnet around late February 2024.

title: Has Ethereum finally bottomed vs. Bitcoin? ETH price technicals hint at gains - Cointelegraph
summary: Ethereum (ETH) may be poised for gains versus Bitcoin (BTC) in the coming weeks, based on favorable technical indicators and bullish divergences. The ETH/BTC pair is currently forming a falling wedge pattern, which could resolve to the upside if the upper trendline is broken. However, veteran trader Peter Brandt argues that this pattern could be a descending triangle, a bearish indicator. The weekly chart also suggests a potential rebound by New Year’s and during the first quarter of 2024, as the price forms lower highs while the relative strength index (RSI) makes higher lows. Support confluence near 0.048-0.052 BTC limits the downside prospects, enabling a rebound toward the 200-week exponential moving average (EMA) near 0.057 BTC. Conversely, the bears will try to pull the ETH price below the support confluence, which could risk crashing it to 0.036 BTC, a historically significant resistance level.

title: Ethereum To Crash Below $2,000? Veteran Trader Peter Brandt Predicts ETH Will Head Lower if This Happens - The Daily Hodl
summary: Veteran trader Peter Brandt predicts Ethereum (ETH) could fall to $1,893 if it forms a "decisive close below the lower boundary" of a descending triangle pattern. Brandt also identifies a bull flag pattern on Bitcoin's (BTC) daily chart, which could signal the continuation of the upward movement. However, Ethereum has depreciated 36% against Bitcoin year-to-date on the ETH/BTC pair, suggesting a downward trend persisting.

title: Ethereum Could Explode by Over 100% and Hit New All-Time High, According to BitMEX Founder Arthur Hayes - The Daily Hodl

He also shares his thoughts on the possible approval of spot Bitcoin (BTC) exchange-traded funds (ETFs), including the differences between a cash redemption model and an "in-kind" model.

title: Ethereum (ETH) Layer-2 Scaling Solution Witnesses 391% Growth in Addresses This Year: IntoTheBlock - The Daily Hodl
summary: Optimism (OP) layer-2 scaling solution on Ethereum (ETH) has seen a massive 391% growth in addresses since January, with over 5.9 million addresses now holding OP. The native token OP is up 16% in the past 24 hours and 180% since the start of the year. Despite this growth, Optimism still lags behind rival Arbitrum (ARB) in terms of daily transactions. Coinbase's newly launched Ethereum scaler Base, which is powered by Optimism, witnessed around 304,000 transactions on Thursday.

title: Ethereum Regains Strength: Breaking This Barrier May Lead the ETH Price To $3,500 - Coinpedia Fintech News
summary: Ethereum (ETH) has regained strength, with a potential breakout above $2312-2337 resistance zone. If successful, it could lead to a rally towards $2500 and potentially invalidate a bearish trend. The RSI and TSI are bullish, and buying pressure is coiled up, suggesting an ascending trend for the long term. A breakout above $2386.82 could lead to an extended bullish upswing, potentially reaching $3500 during the first quarter of 2024.

Solana's price has increased by 665% since January, with a 33% increase in 24-hour trading volume to over $5.86 billion. Solana is gaining ground on Ethereum, with activity on the chain rivaling Ethereum in DEX volume, NFT volumes, active addresses, transaction count, and stablecoin transfers. While Solana still has a long way to go to match Ethereum's network effects and price, it is on its way to revisiting its current all-time high of $259 in the first half of 2024.

However, the lack of institutional investment in Ethereum could hinder its potential growth. Overall, the outlook for Ethereum in 2024 is bullish, with a potential target of $4,000.

title: Ethereum Pops 4% as Solana Nips at Its Heels - Decrypt
summary: Ethereum (ETH) has seen a 4% increase in value in the past day, with a current price of $2,324. This comes after core developers announced plans to roll out DenCun, a series of updates aimed at reducing gas fees and improving network capacity. Crypto trader Peter Brandt has reversed his bearish prediction on ETH due to the positive sentiment around the upgrade. Other scaling solutions, such as Optimism (OP) and Arbitrum (ARB), have also seen significant gains, with OP up 27% and ARB up 19% in the past day. Meanwhile, Solana (SOL) continues to climb, with a 2% increase in the past day and a current market cap of $40.6 billion, edging out Binance's BNB as the fourth largest cryptocurrency by market cap. Despite this, Ethereum remains the leader in NFT trading, with $11.7 million worth of trades in the past day, followed by Solana with $10.6 million.

However, Santiment advises SOL holders to be cautious, as the coin's social volumes have seen a significant uptick, indicating potential volatility.

summary:

Retik Finance (RETIK) is a new crypto project that is gaining momentum in the DeFi space. It offers a unique approach and innovative solutions that challenge Ethereum's dominance. Retik Finance has raised $1.4 million in its presale and launched a mega giveaway worth $333K. The project's commitment to community empowerment and inclusivity sets it apart from other crypto projects. Retik Finance's vision extends beyond financial gains and seeks to change the concept of decentralized finance. title: Ethereum Price About To Bloom As ETHE Discount Rapidly Close: ETH To $3,500? - Bitcoinist
summary: Ethereum (ETH) prices have been low despite other cryptocurrencies' success, but the ETHE discount is closing rapidly, suggesting institutional investors are buying ETH directly on the spot market instead of through derivatives. This could lead to increased capital flows to the ETH spot, potentially lifting the price to $3,500. As Ethereum is a proof-of-stake (POS) project, users can stake ETH and earn a yield of around 4.3%, which could also contribute to higher prices. The ETH price is currently above $2,400, with a potential to reach $2,500 and later $3,500.

title: Lido launches liquid crypto staking on institutional Ethereum - The Cryptonomist
summary: Hashnote, a Miami-based technology company, has launched the stETH Fund, a regulated investment product that allows institutional clients to participate in Ethereum's liquid staking through Lido's decentralized liquid staking middleware. The fund is designed to meet the highest standards required by institutional investors and offers multiple advantages, including reliability, compliance, safety, maximized earnings, ease of use, and a T+0 refund. The launch of the stETH Fund reflects the growing demand for crypto investment solutions, particularly in liquid staking, and highlights the increasing innovation in the LSD market on Ethereum. With over 12 million ETH locked on the beacon chain, liquid staking platforms like Lido have seen significant growth, and the market is expected to continue to expand as more investors seek convenient and yield-generating solutions.
